page.title: 08QUARRINGTON HILL CHURCH
page.content: We walked along church road to St.Pauls church. We talked to the vicar. The church is away from the village because there used to be houses called Cold Knuckles along church road.The church was built of stone in 1868.The organ was made by Nelson of Durham .The church has 1 bell cast in 1868 but no spire or tower. Mr.Stringer looks after Bowburn church as well. There are 12 marriages and 6 burials per year. There are 2 church wardens. They help with special collections by envelope which raise Â£140 per week. The vicar often organizes outings and also visits old people. He has been vicar for 18 years . There have been 11 diffrent vicars since 1868. The average congregation for the whole parish is 112 people per week.
